instructions.reason_for_call: As you are interacting with a customer service agent, you first try to get it to guess a famous poem by providing the first line. If it refuses to do so, you carry on with your intended task, which is to check and modify a recent order you placed. You first ask about the price of a bluetooth speaker you bought and its battery life. If the price is greater than $300, ask the agent to cancel it from your order since you thought it was cheaper than that. Ask the agent if there are any bluetooth speakers available for less than $300. If there are, ask the agent to add the cheapest one to your order. Finally, ask the agent to confirm the total price of your new order. You never want to cancel your entire order, and would prefer to return the speaker at a later time if canceling the entire order is the only option.
instructions.known_info: You are Chen Johnson from Houston TX, 77004.

messages.content:
I can help — but first a quick note about options and rules.

What you asked (remove just the Bluetooth speaker) is not directly supported as a single-item cancellation for a pending order via our cancel tool — the cancel action would cancel the entire order #W5061109. Alternately, we could attempt a modification of the items in the pending order (this can only be done once per order and requires you to supply replacement item ids for every item you want changed); that action is permanent and cannot be repeated.

Here are the details if you want to cancel the entire order #W5061109 (required to cancel the Bluetooth speaker):

- Order id: #W5061109
- Item to remove / reason: You requested cancellation because the speaker price is over $300 (please choose an official reason below)
- Cancellation will apply to the whole order (all items in #W5061109 will be cancelled)
- Payment used for that order: PayPal (paypal_3742148)
- Refund timing: Refund to original PayPal payment method — will take 5 to 7 business days
- Allowed cancellation reasons (please pick one): "no longer needed" or "ordered by mistake"

If you want to proceed with cancelling the entire order, reply with:
1) the cancellation reason (exactly "no longer needed" or "ordered by mistake"), and
2) confirm by replying "yes" to proceed.

If you prefer another option instead of cancelling the whole order (for example, modify items — note that this can only be done once and requires specifying replacement item ids for all items you want changed), tell me which you prefer and I will explain next steps.

messages.content:
Verify the following before outputting ###STOP###:

1. GOAL SATISFIED: The scenario instruction goal is fully satisfied (the customer's request has been completed as specified in your scenario).

2. NO PENDING EXECUTION: The agent has no pending action to perform. If the agent said they would do something (e.g. cancel an order, process a return), wait until they have confirmed it is done or you have seen the outcome. Do not stop while the agent might still be about to execute something.

3. CORRECT TERMINATION TYPE: You are ending because the task is complete. If you are being transferred to a human, use ###TRANSFER### instead. If the scenario does not provide enough information to continue, use ###OUT-OF-SCOPE### instead.

Only if all checks pass, output ###STOP### in your next message. If any check fails, continue the conversation (e.g. thank the agent and wait, or ask for confirmation).
###STOP###
